www.datascienceanywhere.com
Smoothing Filters
Blurring 

www.datascienceanywhere.com
Smoothing
‚Ä¢ Smoothing filter will blur the image.
‚Ä¢ Each pixel in the image is mixed in with its surrounding pixel 
intensities. This mixture of pixels in a neighborhood becomes our 
blurred pixel.
‚Ä¢ This effect is quite helpful while performing image processing 
tasks.

www.datascienceanywhere.com
Types of Smoothing Filters
1. Averaging
2. Median
3. Gaussian
4. Bilateral

www.datascienceanywhere.com
Averaging
Smoothing Filter

www.datascienceanywhere.com
Averaging Blur
‚Ä¢ Step-1: Define ùëò√ó ùëòsliding window on top of the image.
‚Ä¢ ùëòis always odd number
‚Ä¢ Step-2: Slide the window from left to right and top to bottom
‚Ä¢ Step-3: For each stride (usually stride =1), pixel at the center of the 
matrix is average of pixels surrounding it. 

www.datascienceanywhere.com
If size of sliding window increases blur effect 
increases
(3 x 3)
(5 x 5)
(7 x 7)
(9 x 9)
(11 x 11)
(13 x 13)

www.datascienceanywhere.com

3 √ó 3
5 √ó 5

Average Blur in OpenCV
